comments.text: In the latest nightly builds of Firefox on Windows 7, smooth scrolling doesn't work at quora.com.  When I scroll with the keyboard or the scrollbar buttons, the page moves down in chunks as if smooth scrolling was disabled. Other pages seem to work fine so I know my settings for smooth scrolling are correct.

comments.raw_text:
Quora's frontend performance is still, today, noticeably worse than on other browsers. Quora on Firefox is disturbingly sad to use. Is there a way for us to profile this and see what they are doing that Firefox performs so badly on?

There are two pieces to a solution here: If they are doing something that should not be done[tm], then we should evangelize and make sure people know what *not* to do.

And if other browsers handle it fine, of course we should aim for parity in Firefox.

Related: <http://www.quora.com/Mozilla-Firefox/Quora-runs-slow-taking-100-of-one-processor-on-my-Firefox-Does-anyone-else-have-this-problem>

comments.text:
Quora has a key press listening which calls window.scrollBy to scroll and then returns false so we don't take the normal path for scrolling. window.scrollBy does an instant scroll and not a smooth scroll.

Slow or bad scrolling should be a separate bug.
